document.masterDocTitle: Classification, Natural History, and Evolution of the Epiphloeinae (Coleoptera: Cleridae). Part VIII. The Genera Acanthocollum Opitz, Stegnoclava Opitz, and Ichnea Laporte

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Classification, Natural History, and Evolution of the Epiphloeinae (Coleoptera: Cleridae). Part VIII. The Genera Acanthocollum Opitz, Stegnoclava Opitz, and Ichnea Laporte

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Kansas Wesleyan University, Department of Biology 100 East Claflin Avenue, Salina, KS 67401 - 6196 U. S. A.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Enoplium frenatum Erichson, 1847: 86
. Lectotype ♂ . Herein designated. Peru , v. Tschudi (ZMHB). (Specimen pin mounted; support card, gender label affixed to support card; locality-identification label; type label; repository label; specimen number label-58874; historical collection label; ZMHB acronymic label; Opitz lectotype label; plastic vial with abdomen and aedeagus.) Gemminger and Harold 1869: 1751; Lohde 1900: 101; Schenkling 1903: 102, 1910: 122; Blackwelder 1945: 389; Corporaal 1950: 270.

Ichnea disjuncta Gorham, 1877: 411
. Amazon, Ega, Bates Lectotype ♀ . New synonymy . (BMNH). Herein designated. Two paralectotypes from the same locality as the holotype; one in BMNH and one in ZMAN. Gorham 1883: 180; Lohde 1900: 100; Schenkling 1903: 102, 1910: 122; Blackwelder 1945: 389; Corporaal 1950: 270. The characteristics used to describe this nominal species represent intraspecific variation.

Ichnea panamensis Gorham, 1883: 179
. Lectotype . Gender not known. Herein designated. Bugaba, Panama , Champion (BMNH). New synonymy . Three paralectotypes in the BMNH, one in MNHN, and one in ZMAN; all from Bugaba , Panama . The characteristics used to describe this nominal species represent intraspecific variation. Lohde 1900: 102; Schenkling 1903: 102, 1910: 123; Blackwelder 1945: 389; Corporaal 1950: 272; Opitz 1997: 75.

Ichnea subfasciata Gorham, 1877: 410
. Lectotype ♂ . Herein designated. Amazon, Ega, Bates (MNHN). New synonymy . Two paralectotypes in BMNH. The characteristics used to describe this nominal species represent intraspecific variation. Lohde 1900: 102; Schenkling 1903: 102, 1910: 124; Blackwelder 1945: 389; Corporaal 1950: 272.

Ichnea mitella Gorham, 1877: 411
. Lectotype ♂ . Herein designated. Amazon, Bates (BMNH). New synonymy . Eleven paralectotypes in BMNH and two in MNHN. The characteristics used to describe this nominal species represent intraspecific variation. Waterhouse 1883: Table 126, Fig. 5 ; Lohde 1900: 101; Schenkling 1903: 102, 1910: 123, 1916: 151; Jacob 1940: 216; Blackwelder 1945: 389; Corporaal 1942: 142, 1950: 272.

Ichnea femoralis Schenkling, 1900: 401
. Lectotype , gender not known. Jatahy , Goyas , Brésil (MNHN). New synonymy . One paralectotype . Brazil : Goiás : Jataí (MNHN). The characteristics used to describe this nominal species represent intraspecific variation.

Ichnea striaticollis Kuwert, 1894: 11
. Lectotype ♂ . Herein designated. Amazon , Peru (MNHN).
New synonymy
. One paralectotype in MNHN. The characteristics used to describe this nominal species represent intraspecific variation. Lohde 1900: 102; Schenkling 1903: 102, 1910: 124; Blackwelder 1945: 389; Corporaal 1942: 143, 1950: 272.

caption.paragraph:
Figs. 98–101.
Ichnea frenata
. 98) Postocular region; 99) Postocular setae; 100) Last antennomere; 101) Elytral setae.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Ichnea confluens Kuwert, 1894: 12
. Lectotype ♂ . Herein designated, Amazon , Peru (MNHN).
New synonymy
. One paralectotype in MNHN. The characteristics used to describe this nominal species represent intraspecific variation. Lohde 1900: 100; Schenkling 1903: 102, 1910: 122; Blackwelder 1945: 389; Corporaal 1950: 270.
Diagnosis. The complete or partial division of the pronotal central dark line easily distinguishes the members of this species from congeners.

Description. Size : Length 12.5 mm ; width 3.0 mm. Form ( Fig. 134 ): Narrowly triangular. Integumental color ( Figs. 90–94 ): Cranium mostly yellow, lower frons dark brown, dark markings behind eye continuous dark branches of pronotal dark discal line, lower pronotal margin dark brown; elytra mostly yellow, with broad dark sutural line extended to dark broad fascia at elytral middle, yellow at and behind humerus and narrowly yellow along epipleural margin. Head : HW/PW 1.0; frons indented; EW/VW 2.1; antenna as in Fig. 171 , funicle not compressed. Thorax : Pronotum as in Fig. 134 , PL/PW 1.1; elytra long subovoid, EL/PL 5.6; EL/EW 2.5; anterior margin of protibia with 14 spines. Male genitalia : Aedeagus as in Fig. 180 .

caption.paragraph:
Figs. 102–105.
Ichnea spp.
102) Forebody of
I. frenata
; 103) pronotal trichobothrium of
I. divisa
; 104) Metatibia and metatarsus of
I. praeusta
; 105) Section of elytron of
I. praeusta
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation. Size: length 6.5–11.0 mm; width 1.5–2.6 mm . The discal dark pronotal line may be completely divided into two lines or slightly divided anteriorly. Also, the apex of the antenna may be yellow or dark brown. The antennal apex is yellow in all Ecuadoran specimens examined. There is considerable additional variation in elytral color as depicted in Figs. 90–94 .

Natural History. Specimens have been collected throughout the year. Some were taken in secondary forest and others in a Malaise trap. Henry A. Hespenheide captured one specimen on a fallen tree of
G. glabra
.
Distribution. The range of this species extends from Nicaragua to Brazil ( Map 4 ).
